Description: Small black-glazed Attic pottery bowl with convex body and ring foot; a fragment from the rim is missing, the glaze is worn and chipped, and there are traces of a whitish deposit in places. Graffito under foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 587)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1832)
